title: What makes Mahler's Seventh Symphony so inaccessible compared to his other symphonies? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can’t understand why a work like Mahler’s Seventh Symphony would be considered inaccessible. Schoenberg’s Moses und Aron is inaccessible; Mahler’s Seventh is just a bit formless and rambling, that’s all. But the Seventh’s got glory and charm and wonder. And Mahler coaxes both brilliant and original sounds out of the orchestra, particularly those marvellous woodwind timbres. It’s a work that lacks clear form and symmetry, yet Mahler’s voice is so compelling throughout. But I like architecture that is just rambling genius lacking symmetry, too.

I guess its a result of the transition from the more conventional 5th and 6th style to that of the 9th (and 10th fragment) (with the 8th in-between being an outlier), which connects Mahler to Schoenberg and the atonal movement. Also, consider that a lot of Mahler reception depends on interpretation, and given there are so many other pieces of Mahler which have been underappreciated over decades and represented low hanging fruits for re-discovery, there was little incentive to try it with this difficult one. I think the interpretation problem though has been fixed at least since the 70ties, and you can find very good recordings of the 7th, but still rarely live performances. For me the 7th is one of my favorites. You just have to hear it often enough :-)

I don’t know why, it’s not one of my favorite Mahler pieces either, although I will say I love the Song of the Night part. That’s gorgeous stuff. Mahler seems to be one of those composers people either “get” him or they don’t. I will admit, I have to force myself to pay attention when I listen to Mahler, he seems to go off-track or get distracted, and then my mind starts wandering, and I have to pinch myself to stay focused on where he’s going and what he’s doing with his material.

What makes Mahler's Seventh Symphony so inaccessible compared to his other symphonies? Thanks for the A2A I enjoy Mahler’s works. You know, I have tried to like that symphony but it does not have a theme or musical event that I can hang my hat on. I need clear themes to listen to music of that length.
